TopicTitle: Is there a chute mod that's maintained?

Articles.Content: Leaving aside all the social aspects of Real Chute, is Cerebrate's fork mentioned in that thread available somewhere and still maintained?

I don't believe so.

Technically your best bet, in my opinion, is still Real Chute and stay away from the stock chutes.

i'm happy to be corrected though.
I agree, RealChute is the best choice. I can't say I recommend Cerebrate's fork. I'm not sure he fully knows what he is doing.

so hey, not trying to start a wildfire here, but what do you mean by "social aspects"? I read through real chute's features and am led to believe that you are not referring to the mods features, but rather something forum side?
It's a long story, it's over. Let it go.

As far as I can tell, the latest release (by stupidchris) of RealChute works if you delete RealChute/ModuleManager/Stock_Realchute_MM.cfg. This disables all RealChute functionality on the stock chutes and might screw with staging them (I had to right-click deploy manually when I tested it), but the alternative is either not having stock chutes at all (either deleting them or not using them), or not using RealChute at all.

EDIT: Just to clarify, it might've also been a goof with using MJ's autostage: I was mostly just interested in seeing whether loading a savegame would crash everything again.

Edited October 10, 2014 by Starman4308

Leaving aside all the social aspects of Real Chute, is Cerebrate's fork mentioned in that thread available somewhere and still maintained?

Please note that Chris announced that anyone asking for support on the x64 version will lose all rights to support - for x86 too. I am not going to comment on that, as this whole situation is sticky and unnecessary as it is, but just so you know.

To clarify: I don't have a fork. I have a crack.

(Since licensing issues, etc., are being thrown around, this is a distinction I want to make sure is clear, whatever your opinions on the various issues around same are.)

-c
My mistake. I should have read the thread more closely.
